definition: to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
to grow/to nourish/to increase/to cause/juice/taste/(dialect) to spout/to spurt
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
disorderly behavior (PRC law)
drunken fighting/to get drunk and quarrel

sentences.english: Frank always gets into brawls at school.
sentences.chinese: 法兰克经常在学校打架滋事。

sentences.english: Drunken youths hang around outside looking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 喝醉的年轻人在街头游荡，酗酒滋事。

sentences.english: Two people quarrel is Xie Xiaonuo heard, she drove Fang Jia of trouble in the company.
sentences.chinese: 两人争吵被谢小诺听见，她赶走了在公司滋事的方嘉。

sentences.english: Particularly pay attention on the madman or drunk man in hotel to prevent any accidents.
sentences.chinese: 注意发现和防止精神病患者，醉酒者在酒店滋事。

sentences.english: That young man is very quarrelsome, he is always trailing his coat.
sentences.chinese: 那个年轻人很爱吵架，他总是滋事生非。

sentences.english: Drinking alcoholic beverage before and during work thus affecting the order of production.
sentences.chinese: 在工作前或工作中酗酒滋事影响生产秩序者。

sentences.english: He often drinks heavily and creates trouble.
They were convicted of affray and received community service sentences.
sentences.chinese: 他们因殴斗滋事被判决为社区义务服务。

sentences.english: The man became belligerent when he drank too much beer.
sentences.chinese: 这个男人喝多了啤酒之后就变得爱寻衅滋事。

definition: to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
to pick a quarrel/to start a fight

armed (robbery etc)
to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
to gather together/to muster
to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
to gather a crowd/to muster
violent crime/to commit a violent act (assault or murder)
to start rumours and create trouble
armed confrontation/bust-up between gangs
drunken fighting/to get drunk and quarrel
to break the law/to commit a crime
extortion and blackmail (idiom)
to resist arrest
